paragraphs.content: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language;
paragraphs.contentHtml: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language;

paragraphs.content: Judah was his sanctuary, and Israel his dominion.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Judah was his sanctuary, and Israel his dominion.

paragraphs.content: The sea saw it, and fled: Jordan was driven back.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The sea saw it, and fled: Jordan was driven back.

paragraphs.content: The mountains skipped like rams, and the little hills like lambs.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The mountains skipped like rams, and the little hills like lambs.

paragraphs.content: What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?
paragraphs.contentHtml: What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?

paragraphs.content: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams; and ye little hills, like lambs?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams; and ye little hills, like lambs?

paragraphs.content: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob;

paragraphs.content: Which turned the rock into a standing water, the flint into a fountain of waters.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which turned the rock into a standing water, the flint into a fountain of waters.
